newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan Feb motorcycle output falls 1.3% yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Japan Feb motorcycle output falls 1.3% yr/yr.

text.p: Japan's motorcycle production in February fell 1.3 percent from a year earlier to 222,843 motorcycles, the first fall in two months on a year-on-year basis, the Japan Automobile Manufacturers' Association (JAMA) said on Monday.
February production by Japan's top four manufacturers, with
percentage changes from a year earlier, was as follows:
February output included one motorcycle made by a smaller maker, against three a year earlier.
Domestic motorcycle sales rose 1.4 percent from a year earlier to 105,705 in February.
The association expects Japan's motorcycle exports in February to show a gain of about one percent from a year earlier.
Japanese output from April 1996 to February 1997 totalled 2,358,429 motorcycles, down 3.3 percent from the same period a year earlier, it said.
